meanings.definition: The tendency to break up into separate parts or groups.
meanings.sent1: The fissiparousness of the organization led to different departments working independently.
meanings.sent2: Political fissiparousness can weaken a country's unity.
meanings.sent3: The family's holiday planning showed a comical fissiparousness as everyone wanted to go to a different destination.
meanings.sent4: The fissiparousness of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put them back together.
meanings.sent5: The fissiparousness of the ingredients in the salad made it difficult to mix them evenly.

meanings.definition: The state of being divisive or causing division.
meanings.sent1: The fissiparousness in the team caused conflicts among the members.
meanings.sent2: His remarks had a fissiparousness effect on the group, leading to disagreements.
meanings.sent3: The fissiparousness of opinions during the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent4: The fissiparousness of the debate created a rift between the two sides.
meanings.sent5: The fissiparousness of the situation escalated tensions within the community.
